title: 107_hr977
content: The "Classroom Safety Act of 2001" may be cited as the short title. Amendments to the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act are included in the Act. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is amended to allow school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for carrying weapons or using illegal drugs on school premises. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possessing illegal drugs at school, with the ability to modify the disciplinary action on a case-by-case basis. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for unintentional possession of a weapon or illegal drugs, or involvement in the sale of controlled substances. Expelled or suspended children are not entitled to educational services during that time. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possession of a weapon or drugs. Expelled or suspended children may not receive educational services, but the local educational agency can choose to continue providing services in such cases. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possession of a weapon or drugs. The local educational agency is required to provide the child with a free appropriate public education, but the level of service and location of services is at the discretion of the agency. No agency will be considered in violation of the Act for providing discipline, services, or assistance in accordance with the requirements. In accordance with the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, actions taken under this provision are exempt from certain provisions of the Act. Amendments are made to sections 615(f)(1) and 615(k)(1)(A)(ii) to clarify exceptions to disciplinary actions for students with disabilities.
